chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall x y : Z, 0 < x -> 0 <= Z.mul x y -> 0 <= y

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
OMEGA2 : forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x + y
Zle_sign_neg_neg : forall x y : Z, x <= 0 -> y <= 0 -> 0 <= x * y
Zle_sign_pos_neg : forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> y <= 0 -> x * y <= 0
Zle_sign_neg_pos : forall x y : Z, x <= 0 -> 0 <= y -> x * y <= 0
Zle_sign_pos_pos : forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x * y
Z.eq_sym = RelationClasses.Equivalence_Symmetric : RelationClasses.Symmetric eq Expanded type for implicit arguments Z.eq_sym : forall x y : Z, x = y -> y = x Arguments Z.eq_sym [x y]
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : Z => match y with | 0 => 1 | Z.pos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | Z.neg _ => 0 end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
Zle_pos_neg : forall x : Z, 0 <= - x -> x <= 0
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
QArith_base.Qlt = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => QArith_base.Qnum x * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden y) < QArith_base.Qnum y * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden x) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> Prop Arguments QArith_base.Qlt (_ _)%Q_scope
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => match y with | 0 => Eq | Z.pos _ => Lt | Z.neg _ => Gt end | Z.pos x' => match y with | Z.pos y' => (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Gt end | Z.neg x' => match y with | Z.neg y' => CompOpp (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Lt end end : Z -> Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.gt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Pos.le = fun x y : positive => (x ?= y)%positive <> Gt : positive -> positive -> Prop Arguments Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
Zdiv_rest_proof : forall (x : Z) (p : positive) (q r : Z), x = q * two_power_pos p + r -> 0 <= r -> r < two_power_pos p -> Zdiv_rest_proofs x p
Z.lt_irrefl : forall x : Z, ~ x < x
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => (y + (mul p y)~0)%positive | (p~0)%positive => ((mul p y)~0)%positive | 1%positive => y end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
Zdiv_rest_proofs_sind : forall (x : Z) (p : positive) (P : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p -> SProp), (forall (q r : Z) (e : x = q * two_power_pos p + r) (l : 0 <= r) (l0 : r < two_power_pos p), P (Zdiv_rest_proof x p q r e l l0)) -> forall z : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p, P z
Zdiv_rest_proofs_rect : forall (x : Z) (p : positive) (P : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p -> Type), (forall (q r : Z) (e : x = q * two_power_pos p + r) (l : 0 <= r) (l0 : r < two_power_pos p), P (Zdiv_rest_proof x p q r e l l0)) -> forall z : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p, P z
Zdiv_rest_proofs_ind : forall (x : Z) (p : positive) (P : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p -> Prop), (forall (q r : Z) (e : x = q * two_power_pos p + r) (l : 0 <= r) (l0 : r < two_power_pos p), P (Zdiv_rest_proof x p q r e l l0)) -> forall z : Zdiv_rest_proofs x p, P z
Inductive Zdiv_rest_proofs (x : Z) (p : positive) : Set := Zdiv_rest_proof : forall q r : Z, x = q * two_power_pos p + r -> 0 <= r -> r < two_power_pos p -> Zdiv_rest_proofs x p Arguments Zdiv_rest_proofs _%Z_scope _%positive_scope Arguments Zdiv_rest_proof _%Z_scope _%positive_scope (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive SqrtSpec : positive * Pos.mask -> positive -> Prop := SqrtExact : forall s x : positive, x = (s * s)%positive -> Pos.SqrtSpec (s, Pos.IsNul) x | SqrtApprox : forall s r x : positive, x = (s * s + r)%positive -> (r <= s~0)%positive -> Pos.SqrtSpec (s, Pos.IsPos r) x Arguments Pos.SqrtSpec _ _%positive_scope Arguments Pos.SqrtExact (_ _)%positive_scope Arguments Pos.SqrtApprox (_ _ _)%positive_scope

```coq
intros x y Hx Hy.
destruct x as [|p|p]; destruct y as [|q|q].
- simpl in *. omega.
- simpl in *. rewrite Zle_sign_pos_neg in Hy. omega.
- simpl in *. rewrite Zle_sign_neg_pos in Hy. omega.
- simpl in *. rewrite Zle_sign_pos_pos in Hy. omega.
Qed.
```
